channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: David Gergen, adviser to 4 presidents, dies at 83
item.description: David Gergen worked in the administrations of Presidents Richard Nixon, Gerald Ford, Ronald Reagan and Bill Clinton as a speechwriter, communications ...

item.title: Federal judge orders stop to indiscriminate immigration raids in Los Angeles
item.description: Civil rights groups alleged that ICE and Border Patrol agents are rounding people up based on their race, and denying them access to lawyers. A federa...

item.title: 'Helping every dang soul': Beloved camp director was among those lost in Texas flooding
item.description: Jane Ragsdale ran the Heart O' the Hills camp for girls in Kerr County. The camp was between sessions when the deluge hit. The only person killed ther...

item.title: Federal judge orders ICE to halt immigration raids in Southern California
item.description: The ACLU's federal lawsuit claims the Trump administration's aggressive immigration enforcement operations violate the Constitution.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire talks on verge of collapse, Palestinian officials say
item.description: Senior Palestinian officials accuse Israel of deliberately stalling the negotiations in Qatar during the prime minister's US visit.

item.title: About 200 arrested in immigration raids on Southern California farms, feds say
item.description: Authorities executed criminal search warrants in Carpinteria and Camarillo, California, on Thursday, the Department of Homeland Security said.

item.title: A bridge too far? Prague railway project draws criticism
item.description: The 123-year-old Vysehrad railway bridge is set to be replaced but conservationists say it should stay.

item.title: Federal judge says voice-over artists' AI lawsuit can move forward
item.description: The two voice over artists allege their voices were stolen by an AI voice startup.

item.title: Why cockpit audio deepens the mystery of Air India crash
item.description: Fuel cut-off switches flipped seconds after takeoff in Air India crash, preliminary report finds.

item.title: 'They were just kids': Mother mourns sons killed in Israeli strike while waiting for aid
item.description: Two of Iman al-Nouri's five sons were killed outside a clinic in Deir al-Balah on Thursday, while a third was seriously wounded.

item.title: State Department enacts widespread layoffs, cutting 1,353 staff
item.description: The involuntary staff reductions include 1,107 civil service and 246 foreign service employees, according to a notice sent to employees Friday morning...

item.title: 7/11: CBS Evening News
item.description: Trump surveys deadly storm damage in Texas; Reflecting on the selfless heroism shown during the Texas floods

item.title: 7/11: The Daily Report
item.description: Tom Hanson reports on President Trump's visit to Texas to tour extensive flood damage, and what investigators are revealing about the Air India crash.

item.title: Preliminary report says fuel switches were cut off before Air India Boeing 787 crash

item.title: How US views of immigration have changed since Trump took office, according to Gallup polling
Judge orders Trump administration to halt indiscriminate immigration stops and arrests in California
item.description: A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to halt indiscriminate immigration stops and arrests in Southern California.

item.title: Mourning begins in Texas where more than 170 are still missing from flash floods
